item.title: 在全世界纪念俄罗斯进攻乌克兰两年之际，美国宣布对俄罗斯、其 "帮凶 "及其 "战争机器 "实施 500 多项制裁。
item.description:
The U.S. announced more than 500 sanctions on Russia, its "enablers," and its "war machine" as the world marks two years since Russia attacked Ukraine.

This is the largest single tranche since the start of Russian Pres. Putin's invasion, officials said. https://t.co/jSekuKYNwF

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 新消息：前总统特朗普提交了手机通话记录，据称显示了内森-韦德和法尼-威利斯在佐治亚州选举案中受雇之前的互动。
item.description:

item.description:
A student at the University of Colorado - Colorado Springs who is accused of gunning down two people in a dorm room had an AK-47-style assault rifle and a handgun in his car when he was arrested, according to prosecutors. https://t.co/1TbnYts2gm

item.title: 在巴西亚马逊河流域，一名研究人员正与一条 26 英尺长的南方绿蟒并肩而行。

item.description:
As voters in South Carolina are getting ready to weigh in on Saturday's Republican presidential primary, @ABC News asked supporters of Nikki Haley why they're still pulling for her despite her being so far behind former Pres. Trump in the polls. https://t.co/Xw1t5aIq1w

item.description:
A lawyer for ex-White House aide Cassidy Hutchinson is responding to Biden impeachment inquiry witness Tony Bobulinski in a letter first obtained by @ABC News, providing a photo he says refutes one of Bobulinski's claims. https://t.co/QUXxsJbMfB

item.title: "海莉的生命还有很多可以继续"她再也回不了家了，这才是最悲伤的"宿舍之死纽约州立大学宾汉姆顿分校大四学生海莉-安德森（Haley Anderson）的谋杀案是如何引发一场国际审判的。
item.description:
“There was so much more of life for Haley to live. She’s never coming home, and that is the saddest part."

Death in the Dorms: How the murder of SUNY Binghamton senior Haley Anderson led to an international trial. https://t.co/D1TvuFrIdM

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 研究人员说，他们在东南太平洋的一次考察中发现了 100 多个新物种。他们在智利海岸发现了深海珊瑚、玻璃海绵、海胆、片脚类动物、蹲龙虾等物种。
item.description:
Researchers say they discovered more than 100 new species during an expedition in the southeast Pacific.

They identified species including deep-sea corals, glass sponges, sea urchins, amphipods, squat lobsters, and others off the coast of Chile. https://t.co/H26TVoE7xI pic.twitter.com/qa0VB8IAb5

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: "她在自己家里，和一个应该保护她、关心她、爱她的男人在一起。调查此案的一名警探告诉 @abc2020 说："她当然不应该遭受如此残暴的对待。
item.description:
"She's in her own home, and she's with a man who is supposed to protect her, who's supposed to care for her, who's supposed to love her. And she certainly didn't deserve the brutality that she suffered," a detective who investigated the case told @abc2020. https://t.co/iQAvI5fXdj

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 根据一份新的联邦公告，在总统提名大会开始前的几个月，执法部门已经在计划开展大规模的工作，以保护定于今年夏天举行的总统提名大会。
item.description:
Months before they’re set to begin, law enforcement is already planning a massive effort to protect the presidential nominating conventions set for this summer, according to a new federal bulletin. https://t.co/IKQ7Y9NkdC

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: "很多长期COVID症状......经常被写成'哦，那都是你的幻觉'，但这项研究表明了其背后的实际生物机制。"这项小型研究显示了一些长期COVID患者出现 "脑雾 "的可能原因。
item.description:
"A lot of long COVID symptoms ... are often written off as 'oh that’s all in your head' but this study is suggesting an actual biological mechanism behind it."

Small study shows a possible reason some long COVID patients experience "brain fog." https://t.co/sJq7scc1Nv

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 一名十几岁时就前往叙利亚加入伊斯兰国组织的妇女对英国政府撤销其英国公民身份的决定提出上诉，但最终败诉：

item.title: 随着俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争进入两周年，俄罗斯再次发动攻击，袭击前线城市。这些袭击发生时，国际社会对基辅的援助已经放缓，这意味着乌克兰的武器储备越来越少。
item.description:
As Russia's war in Ukraine hits the two-year mark, Russia is again on the attack, striking cities along the frontline.

Those attacks are coming as international aid for Kyiv has slowed, meaning Ukrainian weapons stockpiles are growing ever smaller. https://t.co/GQMeFPWoRd

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 在全世界纪念俄罗斯进攻乌克兰两年之际，美国宣布对俄罗斯、其支持者及其战争机器实施 500 多项制裁。
item.description:
The U.S. has announced more than 500 sanctions on Russia, its enablers, and its war machine as the world marks two years since Russia attacked Ukraine.

This is the largest single tranche since the start of Putin's invasion, administration officials said. https://t.co/w3VllmtOBh

item.title: 据基辅估计，莫斯科的损失超过 30 万名士兵，因此乌克兰当局发起了一个名为 "想寻找 "的项目，帮助俄罗斯公民寻找他们在乌克兰参战的亲属的信息。
item.description:
With Moscow's losses estimated by Kyiv at more than 300,000 soldiers, the Ukrainian authorities launched a project called "Want To Find" to help Russian citizens find information about their relatives who went to fight in Ukraine. https://t.co/ttuU7kdYnK

— ABC News (@ABC) February 23, 2024

item.title: 现年 99 岁的前总统吉米-卡特（Jimmy Carter）是第一位在世时获得白宫官方圣诞饰品殊荣的美国总统。
item.description:
Former Pres. Jimmy Carter has another distinction to his name.

The 99-year-old is the first of the U.S. presidents to be honored with an official White House Christmas ornament while still living. https://t.co/mp1pdbW0Hh
